name: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid
Reason: 3,3,3-trifluoro-2-hydroxy-2-(trifluoromethyl)propionic acid has a melting point that we will compare to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The trifluoromethyl group introduces a significant dipole moment, which increases intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. The two hydroxyl groups contribute to hydrogen bonding, which can raise the melting point by approximately +20°C each. The carboxylic acid group introduces a polar carbonyl interaction, which can contribute to the melting point by approximately +30°C. The trifluoromethyl group also increases the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, which can contribute to the melting point by approximately +10°C.
